intro: Selinocarpus somalensis, commonly known as the Somali selinocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Somalia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It features slender stems and small, compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are small and clustered, contributing to its ornamental value in certain regions.
